title: Lentil Soup With Harissa & Preserved Lemons

Base: preserved lemon (from 1 [7-oz.] jar), seeded and finely chopped
Vegetables: ½ tsp. kosher salt, plus more to taste
oz. Swiss chard, stalks and leaves shredded (3 cups)
oz. fresh broccolini, chopped into ½-in. pieces (2 cups)
Aromatics: oz. fresh mint leaves, chopped (about ¼ cup), divided
Finishing: 3 ½ Tbsp. extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for serving
1 large (10-oz.) yellow onion, finely chopped (2 cups)

steps: Heat oil in a large pot over medium, Add yellow onion and celery; cook, stirring often, until soft, golden and starting to brown, about 12 minutes.
Add garlic, preserved lemon and harissa; cook, stirring often, until garlic softens, about 5 minutes.
Add stock, lentils and salt to pot; bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce to low, and simmer until lentils are tender, about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Increase heat to medium; add Swiss chard, broccolini and hot water, if needed for a brothier soup (up to 1 1/4 cups). Cook until greens are tender and bright green, 6 to 10 minutes. Remove from heat, and stir in half of the mint and salt to taste.
To serve, divide soup among bowls; top with a dollop of yogurt, fried onions or shallots and remaining mint; drizzle generously with additional extra-virgin olive oil.
